tool_description: Welcome to SendGrid’s Web API v3! This API is RESTful, fully featured, and easy to integrate with.
name: SendGrid
title: SendGrid

api_list.name: Retrieve a specific block
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a specific email address from your blocks list. Blocks happen when your message was rejected for a reason related to the message, not the recipient address. This can happen when your mail server IP address has been added to a blacklist or blocked by an ISP, or if the message content is flagged by a filter on the receiving server.

required_parameters.name: email
required_parameters.description: The email address of the specific block.

api_list.name: Retrieve all blocks
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of all email addresses that are currently on your blocks list.  There are several causes for  emails: for example, your mail server IP address is on an ISP blacklist, or blocked by an ISP, or if the receiving server flags the message content.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit the number of results to be displayed per page.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: The point in the list to begin displaying results.

optional_parameters.name: start_time
optional_parameters.description: Refers start of the time range in unix timestamp when a blocked email was created (inclusive). Ex/ 1514764800

optional_parameters.name: end_time
optional_parameters.description: Refers end of the time range in unix timestamp when a blocked email was created (inclusive). Ex/ 1514764800

api_list.name: Retrieve Google Analytics Settings
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve your current setting for Google Analytics.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/tracking_settings/google_analytics"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/tracking_settings/google_analytics"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Retrieve a bounce
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a specific bounce for a given email address.  A bounced email is when the message is undeliverable and then returned to the server that sent it.

required_parameters.name: email
required_parameters.description: The email address you would like to remove from the bounce list.

api_list.name: Retrieve all bounces
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your bounces. A bounced email is when the message is undeliverable and then returned to the server that sent it.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Optional field to limit the number of results returned. If not used, then 500 is the default limit.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Optional beginning point in the list to retrieve from.

api_list.name: Retrieve all invalid emails
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of all invalid email addresses.  An invalid email occurs when you attempt to send email to an address that is formatted in a manner that does not meet internet email format standards or the email does not exist at the recipient’s mail server.  Examples include addresses without the “@” sign or addresses that include certain special characters and/or spaces. This response can come from our own server or the recipient mail server.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit the number of results to be displayed per page. Example: 10

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Paging offset. The point in the list to begin displaying results. Example: 0

optional_parameters.name: start_time
optional_parameters.description: Refers start of the time range in unix timestamp when an invalid email was created (inclusive).

optional_parameters.name: end_time
optional_parameters.description: Refers end of the time range in unix timestamp when an invalid email was created (inclusive).

api_list.name: Retrieve a specific invalid email
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a specific invalid email addresses.  An invalid email occurs when you attempt to send email to an address that is formatted in a manner that does not meet internet email format standards or the email does not exist at the recipient’s mail server.  Examples include addresses without the “@” sign or addresses that include certain special characters and/or spaces. This response can come from our own server or the recipient mail server.

required_parameters.name: email
required_parameters.description: The specific email address of the invalid email entry that you want to retrieve.

api_list.name: Retrieve all spam reports
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve all spam reports. Spam reports happen when a recipient indicates that they think your email is spam and then their email provider reports this to SendGrid.

optional_parameters.name: start_time
optional_parameters.description: Refers start of the time range in unix timestamp when a spam report was created (inclusive).

optional_parameters.name: end_time
optional_parameters.description: Refers end of the time range in unix timestamp when a spam report was created (inclusive).

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: Limit the number of results to be displayed per page. Example: 10

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Paging offset. The point in the list to begin displaying results. Example: 0

api_list.name: Retrieve a specific spam report
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a specific spam report. Spam reports happen when a recipient indicates that they think your email is spam and then their email provider reports this to SendGrid.

required_parameters.name: email
required_parameters.description: The email address of a specific spam report that you want to retrieve.

api_list.name: Validate Batch ID

required_parameters.name: batch_id
required_parameters.description: The batch ID you want to get. Example: HkJ5yLYULb7Rj8GKSx7u025ouWVlMgAi

api_list.name: Retrieve all scheduled sends
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve all cancel/paused scheduled send information.  The Cancel Scheduled Sends feature allows the customer to cancel a scheduled send based on a Batch ID included in the SMTPAPI header. Scheduled sends cancelled less than 10 minutes before the scheduled time are not guaranteed to be cancelled.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/user/scheduled_sends"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/user/scheduled_sends"

            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Retrieve scheduled send
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve the cancel/paused scheduled send information for a specific batch_id.  The Cancel Scheduled Sends feature allows the customer to cancel a scheduled send based on a Batch ID included in the SMTPAPI header. Scheduled sends cancelled less than 10 minutes before the scheduled time are not guaranteed to be cancelled.

required_parameters.name: batch_id
required_parameters.description: The batch ID you want to retrieve. Example: HkJ5yLYULb7Rj8GKSx7u025ouWVlMgAi

api_list.name: Retrieve all suppression groups associated with the user.
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of all suppression groups created by this user.  Suppression groups, or unsubscribe groups, are specific types or categories of email that you would like your recipients to be able to unsubscribe from. For example: Daily Newsletters, Invoices, System Alerts.  The name and description of the unsubscribe group will be visible by recipients when they are managing their subscriptions.  Each user can create up to 25 different suppression groups.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/asm/groups"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get information on a single suppression group.
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a single suppression group.  Suppression groups, or unsubscribe groups, are specific types or categories of email that you would like your recipients to be able to unsubscribe from. For example: Daily Newsletters, Invoices, System Alerts.  The name and description of the unsubscribe group will be visible by recipients when they are managing their subscriptions.  Each user can create up to 25 different suppression groups.

required_parameters.name: group_id
required_parameters.description: The ID of the suppression group you would like to retrieve.

api_list.name: Retrieve all suppressions for a suppression group
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve all suppressed email addresses belonging to the given group.  Suppressions are recipient email addresses that are added to unsubscribe groups. Once a recipient's address is on the suppressions list for an unsubscribe group, they will not receive any emails that are tagged with that unsubscribe group.

api_list.name: Retrieve all suppression groups for an email address
api_list.description: This endpoint returns the list of all groups that the given email address has been unsubscribed from.  Suppressions are a list of email addresses that will not receive content sent under a given group.

api_list.name: Retrieve Tracking Settings
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of all tracking settings that you can enable on your account.  You can track a variety of the actions your recipients may take when interacting with your emails including opening your emails, clicking on links in your emails, and subscribing to (or unsubscribing from) your emails.  For more information about tracking, please see our User Guide.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The number of settings to return.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Where in the list of results you want to begin retrieving settings.

api_list.name: Retrieve Click Track Settings
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve your current click tracking setting.  You can track a variety of the actions your recipients may take when interacting with your emails including opening your emails, clicking on links in your emails, and subscribing to (or unsubscribing from) your emails.  For more information about tracking, please see our User Guide.

        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Retrieve Subscription Tracking Settings
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve your current settings for subscription tracking.  Subscription tracking adds links to the bottom of your emails that allows your recipients to subscribe to, or unsubscribe from, your emails.  You can track a variety of the actions your recipients may take when interacting with your emails including opening your emails, clicking on links in your emails, and subscribing to (or unsubscribing from) your emails.

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Get Open Tracking Settings
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve your current settings for open tracking.  Open Tracking adds an invisible image at the end of the email which can track email opens. If the email recipient has images enabled on their email client, a request to SendGrid’s server for the invisible image is executed and an open event is logged. These events are logged in the Statistics portal, Email Activity interface, and are reported by the Event Webhook.  You can track a variety of the actions your recipients may take when interacting with your emails including opening your emails, clicking on links in your emails, and subscribing to (or unsubscribing from) your emails.
api_list.code:

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Retrieve all mail settings
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a list of all mail settings.  Mail settings allow you to tell SendGrid specific things to do to every email that you send to your recipients over SendGrid’s Web API.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: Where in the list of results to begin displaying settings.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The number of settings to return.

api_list.name: Retrieve all BCC mail settings
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve your current BCC mail settings.  When the BCC mail setting is enabled, SendGrid will automatically send a blind carbon copy (BCC) to an address for every email sent without adding that address to the header. Please note that only one email address may be entered in this field, if you wish to distribute BCCs to multiple addresses you will need to create a distribution group or use forwarding rules.  Mail settings allow you to tell SendGrid specific things to do to every email that you send to your recipients over SendGrid’s Web API.

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: Retrieve address whitelist mail settings
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve your current email address whitelist settings.  The address whitelist setting whitelists a specified email address or domain for which mail should never be suppressed. For example, you own the domain “example.com,” and one or more of your recipients use email@example.com addresses, by placing example.com in the address whitelist setting, all bounces, blocks, and unsubscribes logged for that domain will be ignored and sent as if under normal sending conditions.  Mail settings allow you to tell SendGrid specific things to do to every email that you send to your recipients over SendGrid’s  Web API.

api_list.name: Retrieve footer mail settings
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve your current Footer mail settings.  The footer setting will insert a custom footer at the bottom of the text and HTML bodies. Use the embedded HTML editor and plain text entry fields to create the content of the footers to be inserted into your emails.  Mail settings allow you to tell SendGrid specific things to do to every email that you send to your recipients over SendGrid’s Web API.

api_list.name: Retrieve forward spam mail settings
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve your current Forward Spam mail settings.  Enabling the forward spam setting allows you to specify an email address to which spam reports will be forwarded.  Mail settings allow you to tell SendGrid specific things to do to every email that you send to your recipients over SendGrid’s Web API.

api_list.name: Retrieve all parse settings
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your current inbound parse settings.  The inbound parse webhook allows you to have incoming emails parsed, extracting some or all of the contnet, and then have that content POSTed by SendGrid to a URL of your choosing.

            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

print(response.json())

api_list.name: Retrieve a specific parse setting
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve a specific inbound parse setting.  The inbound parse webhook allows you to have incoming emails parsed, extracting some or all of the contnet, and then have that content POSTed by SendGrid to a URL of your choosing.

required_parameters.name: hostname
required_parameters.description: The hostname associated with the inbound parse setting that you would like to retrieve.

api_list.name: Retrieve email statistics by country and state/province.
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by country and state/province.  We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database. By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.  Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider.

required_parameters.name: start_date
required_parameters.description: The starting date of the statistics to retrieve. Must be in format YYYY-MM-DD

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: How many results to include on each page.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: How many results to exclude.

optional_parameters.name: aggregated_by
optional_parameters.description: How you would like the statistics to be grouped. Must be either "day", "week", or "month".  Allowed Values: day, week, month

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: The end date of the statistics to retrieve.  default: The date the request is made.

optional_parameters.name: country
optional_parameters.description: The country you would like to see statistics for. Currently only supported for US and CA.  Allowed Values: US, CA

api_list.name: Retrieve global email statistics
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve all of your global email statistics between a given date range.

required_parameters.name: start_date
required_parameters.description: The starting date of the statistics to retrieve. Must follow format YYYY-MM-DD.

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: The number of results to return.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: The point in the list to begin retrieving results.

optional_parameters.name: aggregated_by
optional_parameters.description: How to group the statistics. Must be either "day", "week", or "month".

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: The end date of the statistics to retrieve. Defaults to today. Must follow format YYYY-MM-DD.

api_list.name: Retrieve email statistics by device type.
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by the device type.  We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database. By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.

required_parameters.name: start_date
required_parameters.description: The starting date of the statistics to retrieve.

optional_parameters.name: end_date
optional_parameters.description: The end date of the statistics to retrieve. Defaults to today.

optional_parameters.name: aggregated_by
optional_parameters.description: How to group the statistics. Must be either "day", "week", or "month".

optional_parameters.name: limit
optional_parameters.description: How many results to include on each page.

optional_parameters.name: offset
optional_parameters.description: How many results to exclude.

api_list.name: Retrieve email statistics by client type.
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retrieve your email statistics segmented by client type.  We only store up to 7 days of email activity in our database. By default, 500 items will be returned per request via the Advanced Stats API endpoints.  Advanced Stats provide a more in-depth view of your email statistics and the actions taken by your recipients. You can segment these statistics by geographic location, device type, client type, browser, and mailbox provider.

api_list.name: Retrieve all alerts
api_list.description: This endpoint allows you to retieve all of your alerts.
api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/alerts"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com/alerts"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "rapidprod-sendgrid-v1.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
